parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (11240027), which is typically associated with electoral campaign financing and reporting in Romania.  The presence of a CMF number strongly suggests this is related to electoral propaganda.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post does not explicitly mention any parliamentary candidate by name or surname. The Facebook page is associated with Sorin Naș, but the post itself doesn't directly refer to him in the context of the parliamentary elections. The text is religious in nature ("Credința în Dumnezeu și în valorile noastre...") and doesn't explicitly endorse or oppose any candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The post's visibility is not limited to a small group of individuals; it's intended for public consumption.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's content is primarily religious and focuses on faith and values. While Sorin Naș is a politician, the message itself doesn't directly advocate for his election or any other candidate's.  There's no explicit call to action related to voting. The connection to the parliamentary elections is indirect and tenuous at best.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic in nature. It lacks the characteristics of objective reporting, analysis, or opinion pieces on political events. It's a statement of faith, not a news report.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post expresses a personal belief, but it's not presented as an opinion intended to influence the vote. The religious message is not inherently political, although the context of the advertiser being a politician might be considered.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1085453249594392</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
While the advertiser is a politician (Sorin Naș), and the post includes a CMF number, suggesting a connection to electoral activities, the content itself is primarily a religious statement.  It lacks a direct call to vote for or against any candidate in the parliamentary elections. The connection between the religious message and the parliamentary elections is weak.  The "in dubio pro reo" principle should be applied here.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>ALVERNA CONNECT SRL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
